title: Weighted position value for Network games. (arXiv:2308.03494v1 [econ.TH])
abstract: In Network games under cooperative framework, the position value is a link based allocation rule. It is obtained from the Shapley value of an associated cooperative game where the links of the network are considered players. The Shapley value of each of the links is then divided equally among the players who form those links. The inherent assumption is that the value is indifferent to the weights of the players in the network. Depending on how much central a player is in the network, or the ability of making links with other players etc., for example, players can be considered to have weights. Thus, in such situations, dividing the Shapley value equally among the players can be an over-simplistic notion. We propose a generalised version of the position value: the weighted position value that allocates the Shapley shares proportional to the players' weights. translated_title: 权重位置值用于网络游戏
translated_abstract: 在合作框架下的网络游戏中，位置值是一种基于链接的分配规则。它是从一个相关的合作博弈的Shapley值中获得的，其中网络的链接被看作是玩家。然后将每个链接的Shapley值平均分配给形成这些链接的玩家。基本假设是该值对网络中玩家的权重是漠不关心的。根据玩家在网络中的中心性或者与其他玩家建立链接的能力等因素，玩家可以被视为具有权重。因此，在这种情况下，将Shapley值平均分配给玩家可能是一个过于简化的概念。我们提出了一种广义版本的位置值：权重位置值，将Shapley份额按照玩家的权重比例分配。玩家的权重是外生的。我们提供了我们的值的两个公理特征化。最后，我们提供一个招标机制。
tldr: 这篇论文提出了一种权重位置值算法，用于在网络游戏中分配资源。该算法考虑了玩家的权重，根据玩家在网络中的中心性和与其他玩家的链接能力分配资源。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a weighted position value algorithm for resource allocation in network games. The algorithm takes into account the weights of players and allocates resources based on players' centrality in the network and their ability to form links with other players.
